attributes.action: Make the government address national suicide rates and help lower the numbers
attributes.additional_details:
I want our leaders to care, or at the very least, look out for our mental well-being. It needs to be brought up in Parliament and we need to help out those who need our health. I know are MPs are only human too, but if they show that they are trying to help, then we will already be moving in the right direction. 

Thank you
attributes.background: Suicide rates continue to increase and yet we have no daily or weekly statistics that shows just how important this issue is. This is another curve that needs to be flattened.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about access to data on the number of deaths by suicide in England.

However, the Office for National Statistics, which reports to Parliament, publishes quarterly data on this, so it's not clear what further action you would like the Government to take. You can read the ONS data here: https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/birthsdeathsandmarriages/deaths/datasets/deathscausedbysuicidebyquarterinengland.

If you or someone you know have considered or been affected by suicide, please consider contacting the Samaritans for support: https://www.samaritans.org/.

You may also wish to sign these petitions which call for related actions:

'Start a national campaign to highlight the suicide rate in men under 50': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/572636
'Fund a nationwide suicide prevention billboard campaign': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552300
'Increase funding for crisis and acute mental health services': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559871
